title: Digital Health
description: Healthcare organizations must manage health information in a manner that advances their clinical and business goals without running afoul of a patchwork of health information privacy laws and regulations, including the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), the Federal Common Rule, the “Part 2” substance use treatment rules and state privacy requirements. These organizations must also face the growing risk of massive data breaches, which are often the result of malfeasance by sophisticated criminal enterprises. Manatt’s Data Privacy and Security Insights track the evolving risks in this area as well as the latest developments in regulatory enforcement, litigation and risk mitigation strategies.
